You see, I've been lying about my age; I'm not actually 150, I'm 160. Oh, vanity, thy name is Professor Farnsworth. And now that I have nothing to live for, I've alerted the Sunset Squad robots to take me away.

prev: You remind me of Enos. Would you mind walking me home?

name: General
dail: Welcome to Roswell, President Truman.
prev: Uh, how far is it?

name: Truman
dail: ... and a single conspiracy nutter no one will believe.
prev: Welcome to Roswell, President Truman.

name: General
dail: Mr. President, our men have assembled the parts from the alien ship into its original design.
prev: ... and a single conspiracy nutter no one will believe.

name: Truman
dail: Whistling Dixie! I want this sent to Area 51 for study.
prev: Mr. President, our men have assembled the parts from the alien ship into its original design.

name: General
dail: But, sir, that's where we're building the fake moon landing set.
prev: Whistling Dixie! I want this sent to Area 51 for study.

name: Truman
dail: Then we'll have to really land on the moon. Invent NASA and tell them to get off their fannies!
prev: But, sir, that's where we're building the fake moon landing set.

name: Truman
dail: If you come in peace, surrender or be destroyed. If you're here to make war, we surrender.
prev: Then we'll have to really land on the moon. Invent NASA and tell them to get off their fannies!

name: Zoidberg
dail: Both good. The important thing is I'm meeting new people.
prev: If you come in peace, surrender or be destroyed. If you're here to make war, we surrender.

name: Truman
dail: Bushwah! Now what's your mission? Are you planning to make some kind of alien-human hybrid?
prev: Both good. The important thing is I'm meeting new people.

name: Zoidberg
dail: Are you coming onto me?
prev: Bushwah! Now what's your mission? Are you planning to make some kind of alien-human hybrid?

name: Truman
dail: Hot crackers! I take exception to that!
prev: Are you coming onto me?

name: Zoidberg
dail: I'm not hearing a no.
prev: Hot crackers! I take exception to that!

name: Truman
dail: Nerks to this space crab! If we want information, we'll have to do us an old-fashioned alien autopsy!
prev: I'm not hearing a no.

name: Zoidberg
dail: Hooray!
prev: Nerks to this space crab! If we want information, we'll have to do us an old-fashioned alien autopsy!

name: Mildred
dail: Every little thing reminds me of Enos.
prev: Hooray!

name: Fry
dail: Aw, I know how you feel. My grandfather died recently.
prev: Every little thing reminds me of Enos.

name: Mildred
dail: You like holding me, don't you?
prev: Aw, I know how you feel. My grandfather died recently.

name: Fry
dail: Hey, you know what always cheers you up? Baking me a nice tray of sugar cookies!
prev: You like holding me, don't you?

name: Mildred
dail: How 'bout these cookies, sugar?
prev: Hey, you know what always cheers you up? Baking me a nice tray of sugar cookies!

name: Fry
dail: I shouldn't be here. I shouldn't even exist. But I do exist. Which proves ... you can't really be my grandm--
prev: How 'bout these cookies, sugar?

name: Bender
dail: Oh, my God!
prev: I shouldn't be here. I shouldn't even exist. But I do exist. Which proves ... you can't really be my grandm--

name: Farnsworth
dail: What the hell have you done, Fry?
prev: Oh, my God!

name: Fry
dail: Relax! She can't be my grandmother. I figured it all out.
prev: What the hell have you done, Fry?

name: Farnsworth
dail: Of course she's your grandmother, you perverted dope! Look!
prev: Relax! She can't be my grandmother. I figured it all out.

name: Mildred
dail: Come back to bed, deary.
prev: Of course she's your grandmother, you perverted dope! Look!

name: Fry
dail: It's impossible! I mean, if she's my grandmother, who's my grandfather?
prev: Come back to bed, deary.

name: Farnsworth
dail: are!
prev: It's impossible! I mean, if she's my grandmother, who's my grandfather?

name: Mildred
dail: Did you say something, deary? I'm a bit hard of hearing.
prev: are!

name: Pathologist 1
dail: Commencing excavation of the subject's chest cavity.
prev: Did you say something, deary? I'm a bit hard of hearing.

name: Zoidberg
dail: C'mon! Lighten up! What is this, a funeral?
prev: Commencing excavation of the subject's chest cavity.

dail: Heart.
prev: C'mon! Lighten up! What is this, a funeral?

name: Zoidberg

prev: Heart.

dail: Stomach contents
prev: Take, I've got four of them.

dail: Deviled egg?
prev: Stomach contents

dail: #1 deviled egg.
prev: Deviled egg?

dail: Snap out of it!
prev: #1 deviled egg.

name: Farnsworth
dail: the damn radar dish and get back to our own time.
prev: Snap out of it!

name: Fry
dail: But-- But won't that change history?
prev: the damn radar dish and get back to our own time.

name: Farnsworth
dail: Oh, a lesson in not changing history from Mr. I'm-My-Own-Grandpa! Let's get the hell out of here already! Screw history!
prev: But-- But won't that change history?

name: Conspiracy Nutter
dail: UFO! UFO!
prev: Oh, a lesson in not changing history from Mr. I'm-My-Own-Grandpa! Let's get the hell out of here already! Screw history!

name: Zoidberg
dail: Hey, don't cut that! I need that to speak!
prev: UFO! UFO!

name: Pathologist 2
dail: Oh, my!
prev: Hey, don't cut that! I need that to speak!

dail: Sweet Roosevelt's ghost!

dail: Yah!
prev: Sweet Roosevelt's ghost!

name: Fry
dail: Take this, Mr. President-- Sir!

prev: Take this, Mr. President-- Sir!

name: Farnsworth
dail: Huh, wha? Oh, right!
prev: The President is gagging on my gas bladder! What an honour!

name: Sergeant
dail: Enos!
prev: Huh, wha? Oh, right!

name: Fry
dail: Sorry!
prev: Enos!

name: Fry
dail: Yay!
prev: Sorry!

name: Farnsworth
dail: Choke on that, causality!
prev: Yay!

name: Bender
dail: 1947 can kiss my shiny metal--
prev: Choke on that, causality!

name: Fry
dail: Turn around. We've gotta go back for Bender!
prev: 1947 can kiss my shiny metal--

name: Farnsworth
dail: get back to the 31st century.
prev: Turn around. We've gotta go back for Bender!

name: Fry
dail: Bender!
prev: get back to the 31st century.

name: Zoidberg
dail: There! Good as new!
prev: Bender!

name: Leela
dail: Don't you need this one?
prev: There! Good as new!

name: Zoidberg
dail: Gotcha!
prev: Don't you need this one?

name: Fry
dail: Oh, poor Bender. He must be so lonely right now, trapped a thousand years in the past. Hey! Wait a second!
prev: Gotcha!

name: Leela
dail: Anything?
prev: Oh, poor Bender. He must be so lonely right now, trapped a thousand years in the past. Hey! Wait a second!

name: Fry
dail: Wait!
prev: Anything?

name: Bender
dail: Ow! Stupid junk!
prev: Wait!

name: Fry
dail: years?
prev: Ow! Stupid junk!

name: Bender
dail: I was enjoying it until you guys showed up.
prev: years?

name: Farnsworth
dail: Well, now everything is back as it was. And if history doesn't care that out degenerate friend Fry is his own grandfather then who are we to judge?
prev: I was enjoying it until you guys showed up.

name: Bender
dail: Amen!
prev: Well, now everything is back as it was. And if history doesn't care that out degenerate friend Fry is his own grandfather then who are we to judge?

name: Leela
dail: Space pirates!
prev: Amen!

name: Fry
dail: Space pirates?
prev: Space pirates!

name: Leela
dail: You know. Pirates, but in space.
prev: Space pirates?

name: Pirate
dail: Avast, mateys!
prev: You know. Pirates, but in space.

name: Pirate
dail: Electronically transfer your space doubloons, afore I send thee to Davey Jarg's locker!
prev: Avast, mateys!

name: Bender
dail: Hey! Keep it down, you kids! I'm trying to take a nap!
prev: Electronically transfer your space doubloons, afore I send thee to Davey Jarg's locker!

name: Fry
dail: Come on! Come on!
prev: Hey! Keep it down, you kids! I'm trying to take a nap!

name: Bender
dail: Come back when I've had some sleep, baby!
prev: Come on! Come on!

name: Leela
dail: Fry to battlestations. Fire torpedo number three.
prev: Come back when I've had some sleep, baby!

name: Fry
dail: Firing torpedo number three!
prev: Fry to battlestations. Fire torpedo number three.

name: Bender
dail: Huh? What?
prev: Firing torpedo number three!

name: Leela
dail: That's not torpedo three. That's not torpedo three at all!
prev: Huh? What?

name: Bender
dail: --la!
prev: That's not torpedo three. That's not torpedo three at all!

name: Pirate
dail: Too late do I realise that me children are me only real treasures.
prev: --la!

name: Bender
dail: Help! Mechanical man overboard!
prev: Too late do I realise that me children are me only real treasures.

name: Fry
dail: Go after him, Leela!
prev: Help! Mechanical man overboard!

name: Leela
dail: It's no use. We were going full speed when we fired him so he's going even faster than that.
prev: Go after him, Leela!

name: Fry
dail: You mean we can never catch up to him? Not even if we rub the engine with cheetah blood?
prev: It's no use. We were going full speed when we fired him so he's going even faster than that.

name: Leela
dail: I don't know how to say this, Fry, but Bender is doomed to drift through space ... forever.
prev: You mean we can never catch up to him? Not even if we rub the engine with cheetah blood?

name: Fry
dail: He always wanted to drift forever, but through the American Southwest.
prev: I don't know how to say this, Fry, but Bender is doomed to drift through space ... forever.

name: Bender
dail: Damn you!
prev: He always wanted to drift forever, but through the American Southwest.

name: Bender
dail: Well that was fun. Now for eons of loneliness.
prev: Damn you!

name: Bender
dail: Huh?
prev: Well that was fun. Now for eons of loneliness.

name: Shrimpkin Priest
dail: Fellow Shrimpkins, behold him who hath taken us unto his breast.
prev: Huh?

name: Bender
prev: Fellow Shrimpkins, behold him who hath taken us unto his breast.

name: Shrimpkin Priest
dail: All bow before the great Metal Lord!

name: Bender
dail: Worshippers? This ought to liven up my endless, tragic voyage.
prev: All bow before the great Metal Lord!

name: Shrimpkin Priest
dail: All hail the Metal Lord!
prev: Worshippers? This ought to liven up my endless, tragic voyage.

name: Shrimpkins
dail: So hailed!
prev: All hail the Metal Lord!

name: Bender
dail: I am the Metal Lord. Who are you?
prev: So hailed!

name: Malachi
dail: loves the Metal Lord".
prev: I am the Metal Lord. Who are you?

name: Bender
dail: Time for a religious donation. Hand over your wallet.
prev: loves the Metal Lord".

name: Malachi
dail: But, Lord, we are a poor and simple folk.
prev: Time for a religious donation. Hand over your wallet.

name: Bender
dail: Poor? Oh, crap.
prev: But, Lord, we are a poor and simple folk.

name: Malachi
dail: Pity me not, for I am richened by the love of my family.
prev: Poor? Oh, crap.

name: Malachis Wife
dail: What art thou doing, Malachi Jr.?
prev: Pity me not, for I am richened by the love of my family.

name: Malachi
dail: Jr. Mmm! Mmm!
prev: What art thou doing, Malachi Jr.?

name: Bender
dail: Number one...
prev: Jr. Mmm! Mmm!

name: Malachi
dail: Behold
prev: Number one...

name: Bender
dail: Make it a double!
prev: Behold

name: Fry
dail: Can you find him, Professor?
prev: Make it a double!

name: Farnsworth
dail: No. I'm afraid the Smellescope isn't powerful enough. Bender's odour is so mild it's being overpowered by local sources.
prev: Can you find him, Professor?

name: Zoidberg
dail: Hooray! People are paying attention to me!
prev: No. I'm afraid the Smellescope isn't powerful enough. Bender's odour is so mild it's being overpowered by local sources.

name: Amy
dail: Fry, we brought someone to cheer you up.
prev: Hooray! People are paying attention to me!

name: Hermes
dail: His name is Helper and he's eager to be your new best friend.
prev: Fry, we brought someone to cheer you up.

name: Helper
dail: Hello there, chum. I understand you miss your buddy. Have a pudding pop!
prev: His name is Helper and he's eager to be your new best friend.

name: Fry
dail: No, thanks, I don't--
prev: Hello there, chum. I understand you miss your buddy. Have a pudding pop!

name: Helper
dail: Who wants to go to an amusement park?
prev: No, thanks, I don't--

name: Fry
dail: Well, I guess that sounds OK.
prev: Who wants to go to an amusement park?

name: Helper
dail: Have a good time. Hey, I heard your friend Bender is back.
prev: Well, I guess that sounds OK.

name: Fry
dail: What? Really?
prev: Have a good time. Hey, I heard your friend Bender is back.

name: Helper
dail: No. I just thought you would enjoy that for a moment.
prev: What? Really?

name: Bender
dail: Malachi, good work. There's no slowing down with the Metal Lord tonight.
prev: No. I just thought you would enjoy that for a moment.

name: Malachi
dail: Yes, tonight is kind of special.
prev: Malachi, good work. There's no slowing down with the Metal Lord tonight.

name: Bender
dail: Wait a second. Did you rip off your own arm as a joke?
prev: Yes, tonight is kind of special.

name: Malachi
dail: And, of course, the liquor industry attracted organised crime.
prev: Wait a second. Did you rip off your own arm as a joke?

name: Bender
dail: It's all my fault. Malachi, tell thy people that the Lord is moved by their plight.
prev: And, of course, the liquor industry attracted organised crime.

name: Malachis Wife
dail: Malachi Jr., no!
prev: It's all my fault. Malachi, tell thy people that the Lord is moved by their plight.

name: Malachi Jr
dail: Daddy, I can't hold much longer. My arms are tired from hugging.
prev: Malachi Jr., no!

name: Malachi
dail: Save him! Save my son, oh Metal Lord!
prev: Daddy, I can't hold much longer. My arms are tired from hugging.

name: Bender
dail: What the-- Malachi, what manner of deal is this with the chanting?
prev: Save him! Save my son, oh Metal Lord!

name: Malachi
dail: They saw you save my son. Now everyone is praying for their own miracles.
prev: What the-- Malachi, what manner of deal is this with the chanting?

name: Bender
dail: Very well. What do they want?
prev: They saw you save my son. Now everyone is praying for their own miracles.

name: Malachi
dail: The people of that village pray for wealth.
prev: Very well. What do they want?

name: Bender
dail: Um, that was a practice miracle. Who's next?
prev: The people of that village pray for wealth.

name: Malachi
dail: The farmers pray for sunlight so their barley might make a more refreshing beer for today's God on the go.
prev: Um, that was a practice miracle. Who's next?

name: Bender
dail: Um, when you're writing the Bible, you might want to omit that last miracle.
prev: The farmers pray for sunlight so their barley might make a more refreshing beer for today's God on the go.

name: Fry
dail: If I can't reach you physically, I'll just have to try something desperate and crazy!
prev: Um, when you're writing the Bible, you might want to omit that last miracle.

name: Fry
dail: So that's my story, Father Changstein el Gamahl. Is there anything religion can do to help me find my friend?
prev: If I can't reach you physically, I'll just have to try something desperate and crazy!

name: Changstein el Gamahl
dail: Well, we could join together in prayer.
prev: So that's my story, Father Changstein el Gamahl. Is there anything religion can do to help me find my friend?

name: Fry
dail: Uh-huh. But is there anything useful we can do?
prev: Well, we could join together in prayer.

name: Changstein el Gamahl
dail: No.
prev: Uh-huh. But is there anything useful we can do?

name: Gypsy
prev: No.

name: Fry
dail: Bonder? Is it really you?

name: Gypsy
dail: Yes. I am fine. Give the gypsy $10.
prev: Bonder? Is it really you?

name: Fry
dail: Wait a minute! Bender's name isn't Bonder, it's Bender. You're a fraud!
prev: Yes. I am fine. Give the gypsy $10.

name: Gypsy
dail: Look, you want false hope or not?
prev: Wait a minute! Bender's name isn't Bonder, it's Bender. You're a fraud!

name: Fry
dail: Only if you don't have any real hope.
prev: Look, you want false hope or not?

name: Gypsy
dail: Well, there is perhaps one way. Have you heard of the Monks of Dschubba?
prev: Only if you don't have any real hope.

name: Fry
dail: heard of them.
prev: Well, there is perhaps one way. Have you heard of the Monks of Dschubba?

name: Gypsy
dail: They are an ancient order that believes God exists somewhere in the depths of space. They have built the universe's most powerful radio telescope, high in the Himalayas, to search for him.
prev: heard of them.

name: Fry
dail: You think they'd let me use it to look for Bender?
prev: They are an ancient order that believes God exists somewhere in the depths of space. They have built the universe's most powerful radio telescope, high in the Himalayas, to search for him.

name: Gypsy
dail: What am I, psychic? I mean, yes! Yes, I'm-I'm sure they will. Yes.
prev: You think they'd let me use it to look for Bender?

name: Malachi
dail: Oh, Metal Lord, hear my prayer.
prev: What am I, psychic? I mean, yes! Yes, I'm-I'm sure they will. Yes.

name: Bender
dail: Yes, Malachi, what is it this time?
prev: Oh, Metal Lord, hear my prayer.

name: Malachi
dail: My Lord, the infidels on your back no longer believe in you. They say their prayers go unheeded.
prev: Yes, Malachi, what is it this time?

name: Bender
dail: Of course they're unheeded. How am I supposed to hear prayers coming out of my ass?
prev: My Lord, the infidels on your back no longer believe in you. They say their prayers go unheeded.

name: Malachi
dail: They talk of war against the faithful. I beseech thee. Rise up against them. Smite someone who deserves it for once.
prev: Of course they're unheeded. How am I supposed to hear prayers coming out of my ass?

name: Bender
dail: Malachi, every time I interfere, I only make things worse. You're best off solving your own problems.
prev: They talk of war against the faithful. I beseech thee. Rise up against them. Smite someone who deserves it for once.

name: Malachi
dail: But-But Metal Lord.
prev: Malachi, every time I interfere, I only make things worse. You're best off solving your own problems.

name: Bender
dail: What part of "nay" doesn't thou understand?
prev: But-But Metal Lord.

name: Fry
dail: Sir, I'm outfitting an expedition to a monastery high in the Himalayas. I'll need a long-sleeved coat.
prev: What part of "nay" doesn't thou understand?

name: Leela
dail: Look, I miss Bender almost half as much as you do but you can't bring him back this way. It's hopeless.
prev: Sir, I'm outfitting an expedition to a monastery high in the Himalayas. I'll need a long-sleeved coat.

name: Fry
dail: I'd also like a pack mule.
prev: Look, I miss Bender almost half as much as you do but you can't bring him back this way. It's hopeless.

name: Salesman
dail: At once, sir!
prev: I'd also like a pack mule.

name: Leela
dail: Well, you obviously won't listen to reason, so I guess I'll listen to idiotic-ness and come with you. But we'll need a sherpa to guide us.
prev: At once, sir!

name: Bender
dail: Atomic bombs? Oh, no! Those unbelievers from my backside must have found my nuclear pile!
prev: Well, you obviously won't listen to reason, so I guess I'll listen to idiotic-ness and come with you. But we'll need a sherpa to guide us.

name: Malachi
dail: Fear not, my Lord. We shall be with you soon.
prev: Atomic bombs? Oh, no! Those unbelievers from my backside must have found my nuclear pile!

name: Bender
dail: You're with me now. This is the maximum level of being with me!
prev: Fear not, my Lord. We shall be with you soon.

name: Malachi
dail: We will solve our own problems as you commanded. The time has come to convert the unbelievers.
prev: You're with me now. This is the maximum level of being with me!

name: Bender
dail: Convert them?
prev: We will solve our own problems as you commanded. The time has come to convert the unbelievers.

name: Malachi
prev: Convert them?

name: Malachi
dail: Jr. hard he'll save us from--

name: Bender
dail: Ooh! It tickles!
prev: Jr. hard he'll save us from--

name: Bender
dail: They're dead. All dead. Who would have known playing God could have such terrible consequences?
prev: Ooh! It tickles!

name: Leela
dail: Fry, if I drop dead from exhaustion, make sure my body freezes in a dignified position. None of that "huddled over for warmth" crap.
prev: They're dead. All dead. Who would have known playing God could have such terrible consequences?

name: Namgyal
dail: Behold. The Monastery of Dschubba. I must leave you now for I am not holy enough to enter.
prev: Fry, if I drop dead from exhaustion, make sure my body freezes in a dignified position. None of that "huddled over for warmth" crap.

name: Fry
dail: OK.
prev: Behold. The Monastery of Dschubba. I must leave you now for I am not holy enough to enter.

name: Leela
dail: Looks rickety. We'd better test it.
prev: OK.

name: Female Voice
dail: Welcome to our monastery. Please stand to one side to let faster pilgrims by.
prev: Looks rickety. We'd better test it.

name: Bender
dail: Hey! That galaxy's signalling in binary. I gotta signal back. But I only know enough binary to ask where the bathroom is. You speak English?
prev: Welcome to our monastery. Please stand to one side to let faster pilgrims by.

name: Galaxy
dail: I do now.
prev: Hey! That galaxy's signalling in binary. I gotta signal back. But I only know enough binary to ask where the bathroom is. You speak English?

name: Bender
dail: What are you? Some kind of galactic computer?
prev: I do now.

name: Galaxy
dail: Possible. I am user friendly, my good chum.
prev: What are you? Some kind of galactic computer?

name: Bender
dail: Who built you?
prev: Possible. I am user friendly, my good chum.

name: Galaxy
dail: I have always been.
prev: Who built you?

name: Bender
dail: Oh, my God. Are you God?
prev: I have always been.

name: God
dail: Possible. I do feel compassion for all living things, my good chum.
prev: Oh, my God. Are you God?

name: Bender
dail: But why would God think in binary? Unless ... you're not God, but the remains of a computerised space probe that collided with God.
prev: Possible. I do feel compassion for all living things, my good chum.

name: God
dail: That seems probable.
prev: But why would God think in binary? Unless ... you're not God, but the remains of a computerised space probe that collided with God.

name: Monk 1
dail: A member of our brotherhood sits at these controls every hour of every day, scanning the heavens for God.
prev: That seems probable.

name: Monk 2
dail: There he is! No. No, wait, no.
prev: A member of our brotherhood sits at these controls every hour of every day, scanning the heavens for God.

name: Leela
dail: How long have you been at it?
prev: There he is! No. No, wait, no.

name: Monk 1
dail: 700 years. We've not yet examined one-ten-millionth of the sky. But we will go on until we find the Almighty, even if it takes till the end of time.
prev: How long have you been at it?

name: Fry
dail: And then what?
prev: 700 years. We've not yet examined one-ten-millionth of the sky. But we will go on until we find the Almighty, even if it takes till the end of time.

name: Monk 1
dail: Then we utter unto him a short prayer. You see, the telescope is also an amplifying transmitter.
prev: And then what?

name: Leela
dail: Sort of like a giant karaoke machine?
prev: Then we utter unto him a short prayer. You see, the telescope is also an amplifying transmitter.

name: Monk 1
dail: Not really. Would you like to see our giant karaoke machine?
prev: Sort of like a giant karaoke machine?

name: Leela
dail: Not really.
prev: Not really. Would you like to see our giant karaoke machine?

name: Fry
dail: Hmm. Finding God. That-That's important, yeah. But you know what might be a treat for everyone? If you let me use the telescope to find my lost friend, Bender.
prev: Not really.

name: Monk 1
dail: I don't know what to say, other than "absolutely not". Your loss is a tragedy but our work--
prev: Hmm. Finding God. That-That's important, yeah. But you know what might be a treat for everyone? If you let me use the telescope to find my lost friend, Bender.

name: Fry
dail: Aw, come on! You guys have forever to look for God. All I'm asking is one measly lifetime to find my friend.
prev: I don't know what to say, other than "absolutely not". Your loss is a tragedy but our work--

name: Monk
dail: #2 God.
prev: Aw, come on! You guys have forever to look for God. All I'm asking is one measly lifetime to find my friend.

name: Monk 1
dail: Oh, how convenient! A theory about God that doesn't require looking through a telescope. Get back to work!
prev: #2 God.

name: Fry
dail: That telescope is as much mine as anybody's. I'm using it whether you give me permission or not.
prev: Oh, how convenient! A theory about God that doesn't require looking through a telescope. Get back to work!

name: Leela
dail: Hi-yah! Your order may be famous for your martial arts, but I've never met a holy man I couldn't clobber.
prev: That telescope is as much mine as anybody's. I'm using it whether you give me permission or not.

prev: Really?

dail: Because... Because...

name: Fry
prev: Where's the boom? I was expecting a boom.

prev: Sinister Voice You're not the Dark One, I am!

name: Dark One

dail: What's happening out there?
prev: I am the Dark One. The very last Dark One. How is it possible I couldn't read your mind? Oh, I am momentarily disabled.

name: Leela

prev: The star and the asteroid. They were an egg and a sperm.

name: Morbo

prev: Great modem of mercy. Cover the children's eyes.

name: Preacherbot
dail: Then move your fat head. I can't see.

name: Nine
dail: The Encyclopod is reborn. A new green age has begun!
prev: Then move your fat head. I can't see.

name: Mad Fellow
dail: So the legend foretold.
prev: The Encyclopod is reborn. A new green age has begun!

name: Farnsworth
dail: Look! Inside its pouch. Extinct Tasmanian tigers!
prev: So the legend foretold.

name: Amy
dail: And dodo birds!
prev: Look! Inside its pouch. Extinct Tasmanian tigers!

dail: And striped biologist-taunters!

name: Striped biologisttaunter
dail: What are you gonna do, shoot us?
prev: And striped biologist-taunters!

name: Encyclopod
dail: These once extinct plants and animals are my gift to the universe. Through untold generations, my race has treasured their DNA. Treat them wisely with the knowledge that all species are precious.

name: Leela
dail: This is unbelievable. What's going on?
prev: These once extinct plants and animals are my gift to the universe. Through untold generations, my race has treasured their DNA. Treat them wisely with the knowledge that all species are precious.

dail: To answer that, I must tell you a story. A story of two alien species so ancient that-

name: Encyclopod
prev: Hey, how come I can't read your thoughts anymore?

name: Nine

prev: After all these eons, the Dark Ones are no more. Will you preserve their DNA, O Great Encyclopod?

prev: I suppose I should. Wait, where did it go?

dail: Huh. I thought you only saved the DNA of endangered species.

prev: Huh. I thought you only saved the DNA of endangered species.

dail: I guess he didn't hear me.
